root.name: getBoolean()

example.code: # The following short JSON file called "data.json" is parsed # in the code below. It must be in the project's "data" folder. # # # "count": 32, # "weight": 1.13, # "name": "grape", # "isFruit": True # JSONObject json def setup(): json = loadJSONObject("data.json") count = json.getInt("count") weight = json.getFloat("weight") name = json.getString("name") boolean isFruit = json.getBoolean("isFruit") println(count + ", " + weight + ", " + name + ", " + isFruit) # Sketch prints: # 32, 1.13, grape, True

root.description: Gets the boolean value associated with the specified key.
